snippet: As the ranks of those infected with H.I.V. grew, the Cuban government imposed quarantines and set up a network of sanitariums. Now there are only three, with less restrictive living conditions.
abstract: Network of sanitariums in Cuba had a huge dampening effect on the early years of the AIDS epidemic, with fewer than 150 new cases detected in the country each year through 1990; today only three sanitariums remain open.
lead_paragraph: As the ranks of those infected with H.I.V. grew, the Cuban government imposed quarantines and set up a network of sanitariums. Now there are only three, with less restrictive living conditions.

headline.seo: Cuba’s AIDS Sanitariums: Fortresses Against a Viral Foe
headline.main: Cuba’s Fortresses Against a Viral Foe
headline.print_headline: Cuba’s Fortresses Against a Viral Foe
